oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Replacement of soybean oil cake by Hermetia illucens meal in diets for layers
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Maurer, Veronika
Früh, Barbara
Amsler, Zivile
Stamer, Andreas
Leiber, Florian
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Feeding and growth
Poultry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Insect proteins are supposed to be valuable protein sources for monogastric animals. The partial or full replacement of soybean cake by partly defatted meal from Hermetia illucens in a diet for layers did not affect their health, feed intake, feed efficiency nor laying performance and egg weights. These results indicate that insect larvae could serve as a valuable replacer for soybean products in layers diets. However, further research on long-term feeding effects and on resulting egg quality is necessary to approve insect larvae as a practicable source of feed protein.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Maurer, Veronika; Früh, Barbara; Amsler, Zivile; Stamer, Andreas and Leiber, Florian (2014) Replacement of soybean oil cake by Hermetia illucens meal in diets for layers. .
